title.narrative: 1.3 STRENGTHENED LIFE SKILLS & CITIZENSHIP EDUCATION TO IMPROVE LEARNING OUTCOMES

description.narrative: Strengthened life skills and citizenship education to improve learning outcomes among primary and secondary school children., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development, Skills Development (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Enhancing children's potential: By 2020, children of all ages have more equitable access to quality services in protection, education and health, and enhanced opportunities to realize their full potential.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 3787 Ruwi Postal Code 112 Muscat

sector.narrative: Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - mainstreaming of skills development within national education/training system
System strengthening - responsiveness of education/training system to the labour market

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened life skills and citizenship education to improve learning outcomes among primary and secondary school children.

description.narrative: Advocacy and communication efforts were scaled up to support the safe return to schools and ensure that the impact of COVID-19 was viewed as an opportunity to build back better. With the aim of enhancing education quality, promoting adolescents’ social engagement and school-to-work transition, UNICEF provided technical support to the Ministry of Education for operationalization of the National Framework for Future Skills. In addition, key building blocks for the establishment of the Generation Unlimited initiative in Oman were laid to ensure streamlined efforts across sectors for youth training, skills development and engagement.;;; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:13/01/2022
